other_tests.findings: Serum tested positive for MERS-CoV with a titer of 1:3200; nasopharyngeal swab was negative.
other_tests.changes_over_time: By May 3, 2014, the sputum sample was rRT-PCR-positive with a viral load of 5.31 x 10^6 copies/ml. On May 5, 2014, the viral load decreased to 1.26 x 10^5 copies/ml.

other_tests.findings: The genome sequence was similar (>99%) to other known MERS-CoV sequences from KSA.
Serum antibody titers remained high, greater than 1:6400 until the last day of collection.
